result.execSummary:
The defendant McKade L Susag was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co case 15CF581, with the same conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Pay restitution and 10% surcharge as shown in 15CF581 - restitution to be paid within 90 days of today's date.  If not paid it will be considered a violation and cause to be brought back to Court

Complete any other treatment deemed appropriate by the PO

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
